sentence.Network_en: The couple married in the Caribbean to avoid a media circus.
sentence.Network_cn: 为了摆脱媒体的关注，这对新人在加勒比喜结连理。

sentence.Network_en: They had met by chance at university and finished up getting married.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们在大学偶遇，最后结了婚。

sentence.Network_en: I lived there once myself, before I got married.
sentence.Network_cn: 我结婚前曾独自在那儿住过。

entry.def: If you are married, you have a husband or wife.

example.ex: We have been married for 14 years...
She is married to an Englishman.
example.tran: 她嫁给了一个英格兰人。

entry.def: Married means relating to marriage or to people who  are married.

example.ex: For the first ten years of our married life we lived in a farm-house.
example.tran: 我们结婚的头10年住在一座农舍里。

entry.def: If you say that someone is married to their work or another activity, you mean that they are very involved with it and have little interest in anything else.

example.ex: She was a very strict Christian who was married to her job...
example.tran: 她是个虔诚的基督徒，对工作全身心投入。

example.ex: I have little time for women because I'm married to my cricket, so I'm leaving the arrangements to my sister.
example.tran: 我把全部心思都放在了板球上，很少有时间交女友，所以便把约会一事交由姐姐来安排。

means.word_mean: 2. of or relating to the state of marriage;

auth_sentence.content: His mother later married David Hardie, a carpenter.
auth_sentence.res_content: His mother later married David Hardie, a carpenter.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His mother later married David Hardie, a carpenter.

auth_sentence.content: The married father of two is a born-again Christian.
auth_sentence.res_content: The married father of two is a born-again Christian.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The married father of two is a born-again Christian.

auth_sentence.content: She has never married, and now never will.
auth_sentence.res_content: She has never married, and now never will.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She has never married, and now never will.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 表形容词,通常在动词后,"有……的,被……的"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 通常的,习惯的,按照风俗习惯的
stems_affixes.word_buile: accustom使习惯+ed有……的,被……的→通常的,习惯的
ally同盟者+ed有……的,被……的→allied联合的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 耕耘的,有教养的,栽植的
stems_affixes.word_buile: cultivate耕耘,栽植+ed有……的,被……的→cultivated耕耘的
harden变硬+ed有……的,被……的→adj.变硬的,坚毅的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 受伤的,受损害的,受委屈的
感兴趣的,有成见的,有权益的
stems_affixes.word_buile: interest兴趣,关心+ed有……的,被……的→adj.感兴趣的,有成见的,有权益的
limit限制+ed有……的,被……的→adj.有限的,被限制的
note注意到+ed有……的,被……的→被注意的→著名的
pack打包+ed有……的,被……的→adj.充满……的,塞满了……的
repeat重复,反复+ed有……的,被……的→adj.重复的,再三的
suppose猜想,推测+ed有……的,被……的→adj.假定的,假像的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 坏的,邪恶的,缺德的,不道德的
stems_affixes.word_buile: wick+ed有……的,被……的→adj.坏的,邪恶的,缺德的,不道德的
fix固定+ed有……的,被……的→adj.固定的,确定的

Sentence.sentence: At 33 she married Edward Green, a multi-millionaire, and had two children, Ned and Sylvia.
Many societies throughout history and around the world today have cultivated strong pressures to stay married.

If we ask Americans why they eat with knives and forks, or why their men wear pants instead of skirts, or why they may be married to only one person at a time, we are likely to get similar and very uninformative answers: "Because it's right.
During that time, he married one of his students, Natasha Willoughby M: Yes, go on
In America, people are faced with more and more decisions every day, whether it's picking one of thirty-one ice cream flavors, or deciding whether and when to get married.

sentences.en: Married people usually have a different view of life from single people.
sentences.cn: 已婚的人与单身的人通常有不同的人生观。

sentences.en: They have got married for ten years.
The third chapter described their married life.
sentences.cn: 第三章描写他们的婚后生活。
